definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
erhua variant of 打嗝[da3 ge2]

sentences.english: Mr. Lin heaved sigh after sigh. Mrs. Lin's hiccups were like a string of firecrackers .
sentences.chinese: 林先生常常叹气，林大娘的打嗝像连珠炮。

sentences.english: It is impolite to burp at the table.
sentences.chinese: 在餐桌上打嗝是很不礼貌的。

sentences.english: When did he stop hiccupping He stopped in 1991.
sentences.chinese: 她什么时候停止打嗝他在1991年停止的。

sentences.english: And burp , like old clothes because they are comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 和打嗝，像旧衣服，因为他们是舒适。

sentences.english: How long ddi Mr. Smith hiccup?
sentences.chinese: 史密斯先生打嗝打了多长时间？

sentences.english: After burping him, put him in his crip on his right side with his head slightly raised.
sentences.chinese: 让他打嗝以后，孩子应向右侧躺，头稍稍微抬起一点。

sentences.english: Who has the world record for hiccupping?

sentences.chinese: 你什么时候开始打嗝的？

sentences.english: Swedish university is going to measure the greenhouse gases cows give off when they belch.
sentences.chinese: 瑞典一间大学将要测量牛打嗝时所排放的温室气体。

sentences.english: After the feast the prince belched hugely.
We descendants of these animals were left with vestiges of their history, including the hiccup.
sentences.chinese: 我们人类同样也遗留下这些痕迹，包括打嗝。

sentences.english: Never fart, burp, or cuss in public.
sentences.chinese: 永远不要在公共场所放屁，打嗝或者骂人。

sentences.english: But on Thursday night, that hiccup felt like a trembler.
sentences.chinese: 但是在周四晚上，那个打嗝感觉就像发抖。

sentences.english: The kid is making a belch. Give him a drink.
sentences.chinese: 孩子打嗝儿了，让他喝口水吧。

sentences.english: Don't eat too much since you have belched.
sentences.chinese: 你已经打嗝了，不要吃太多了。
打嗝则是很粗鲁的行为。

definition: erhua variant of 打嗝[da3 ge2]
(of food) to retain in stomach due to indigestion (TCM)
